tool.name: PureCLIP
tool.description: - HMM based peak caller designed for eCLIP/iCLIP data
tool.command:
ln -s '${target_bam_file}' target.bam && ln -f -s '${target_bam_file.metadata.bam_index}' target.bam.bai && ln -s '${genome_fasta_file}' genome.fa && #if $control_bam_file: ln -s '${control_bam_file}' control.bam && ln -f -s '${control_bam_file.metadata.bam_index}' control.bam.bai && #end if #if $motif_data.motif_data_selector == 'supply_CL_motifs': ln -s '${motif_data.cl_motif_bed_file}' motif_hits.bed && #end if
pureclip -o crosslink_sites.bed -or binding_regions.bed -nt \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-1} -i target.bam -bai target.bam.bai -g genome.fa #if $learn_params_contigs -iv '$learn_params_contigs' #end if #if $apply_hmm_contigs -iv '$apply_hmm_contigs' #end if -dm $merge_dist #if $control_bam_file: -ibam control.bam -ibai control.bam.bai #end if #if $motif_data.motif_data_selector == 'supply_CL_motifs': -fis motif_hits.bed -nim $motif_data.max_motif_id #end if #if $bc_data.bc_data_selector == 'bc_0': -bc 0 #elif $bc_data.bc_data_selector == 'bc_1': -bc 1 #elif $bc_data.bc_data_selector == 'manual_setting': -bw $bc_data.bandwidth -bwn $bc_data.bandwidthn -b1p $bc_data.b1p -b2p $bc_data.b2p #if $bc_data.antp_option.antp_option_selector == 'antp_select': -antp #elif $bc_data.antp_option.antp_option_selector == 'manual_select': -ntp $bc_data.antp_option.ntp -ntp2 $bc_data.antp_option.ntp2 #end if #end if #if $advanced_params.advanced_params_selector == 'ap_specify': $advanced_params.ld_precision $advanced_params.use_viterbi #if $advanced_params.max_iter_brent -m $advanced_params.max_iter_brent #end if #if $advanced_params.max_iter_bw -w $advanced_params.max_iter_bw #end if #if $advanced_params.g1kmin -g1kmin $advanced_params.g1kmin #end if #if $advanced_params.g1kmax -g1kmax $advanced_params.g1kmax #end if #if $advanced_params.g2kmin -g2kmin $advanced_params.g2kmin #end if #if $advanced_params.g2kmax -g2kmax $advanced_params.g2kmax #end if $advanced_params.fk -mkn $advanced_params.mkn -mtp $advanced_params.mtp #if $advanced_params.mk -mk $advanced_params.mk #end if #if $advanced_params.pa -pa $advanced_params.pa #end if $advanced_params.ea1 $advanced_params.ea2 $advanced_params.et1 $advanced_params.et2 #if $advanced_params.mrtf -mrtf $advanced_params.mrtf #end if -mtc $advanced_params.mtc -pet $advanced_params.pet #end if

param.name: target_bam_file
param.label: Target BAM file

param.name: genome_fasta_file
param.label: Genome reference file

param.name: learn_params_contigs
param.label: Genomic chromosomes to learn HMM parameters
param.help: Genomic chromosomes to learn HMM parameters, e.g. 'chr1;chr2;chr3'. Contigs have to be in the same order as in BAM file. Useful to reduce runtime and memory consumption. Default: all contigs from reference file are used (useful when applying to transcript-wise alignments or poor data).

param.name: apply_hmm_contigs
param.label: Contigs to apply HMM
param.help: Contigs to apply HMM, e.g. 'chr1;chr2;chr3;'. Contigs have to be in the same order as in BAM file.

param.name: merge_dist
param.label: Distance used to merge individual crosslink sites to binding regions

param.name: control_bam_file
param.label: BAM file containing mapped reads from control experiment
param.help: Mapped reads in BAM format from a control experiment, e.g. eCLIP input

param.name: motif_data_selector
param.label: Crosslink-associated (CL) motif options

param.name: cl_motif_bed_file
param.label: FIMO input motif score covariates file
param.help: FIMO input motif score covariates file

param.name: max_motif_id
param.label: Max. motif ID to use
param.help: Max. motif ID to use (Default: only covariates with motif ID 1 are used)

param.name: bc_data_selector
param.label: Define protein binding characteristics
param.option: RBP with short defined binding regions (-bc 0)
RBP with larger crosslink clusters and lower read start counts (-bc 1)

param.name: bandwidth
param.label: Bandwidth for kernel density estimation used to access enrichment
param.help: NOTE: Increasing the bandwidth increases runtime and memory consumption

param.name: bandwidthn
param.label: Bandwidth for kernel density estimation used to estimate n for binomial distributions
param.help: For proteins that rather slide along the RNA or show long crosslink clusters increase -bwn, e.g. to 100 (should be LE 4*bw)

param.label: Initial value for binomial probability parameter of 'non-crosslink' state
Initial value for binomial probability parameter of 'crosslink' state

param.name: antp_option_selector
param.label: Choose n threshold for estimating crosslink state parameters
param.help: Either automatically choose n threshold (-ntp, -ntp2) to estimate parameters linked to crosslink states based on expected read start count at crosslink sites, or manually set values

param.label: Only sites with n >= ntp are used to learn binomial probability parameters
Only sites with n >= ntp2 are used to learn probability of transition from state '2' to '2' or '3'
param.help: Useful for data with low truncation rates at crosslink sites or in general high fraction of non-coinciding read starts

param.name: advanced_params_selector
param.label: Additional advanced parameters

param.name: ld_precision
param.label: Use higher precision to compute emission probabilities (long double)
param.help: Useful in cases of extreme outliers, e.g. extreme high read start counts whose emission probabilities are close to zero and which would be discarded in default setting (along with warning messages). Note: increases memory consumption. Use in combination with '-iv' (default: double)

param.name: use_viterbi
param.label: Use Viterbi instead of posterior decoding

param.name: max_iter_brent
param.label: Maximum number of iterations within BRENT algorithm

param.name: max_iter_bw
param.label: Maximum number of iterations within Baum-Welch algorithm
Minimum shape k of 'non-enriched' gamma distribution
Maximum shape k of 'non-enriched' gamma distribution
Minimum shape k of 'enriched' gamma distribution
Maximum shape k of 'enriched' gamma distribution
Do not constrain 'non-enriched' shape parameter k
param.help: When incorporating input signal, do not constrain 'non-enriched' shape parameter k LE 'enriched' gamma parameter k

param.label: Max. k/N ratio (read start sites/N) used to learn truncation probabilities for 'non-crosslink' and 'crosslink' emission probabilities
param.help: NOTE: high ratios might originate from mapping artifacts that can disturb parameter learning

param.label: Min. transition probability from state '2' to '3'
param.help: Helpful for poor data, where no clear distinction between 'enriched' and 'non-enriched' is possible

param.label: Minimum KDE value used for fitting left-truncated gamma distributions
param.help: Default: corresponding to singleton read start.

param.label: Length threshold for internal poly-X stretches to get excluded
Exclude intervals containing poly-A stretches from learning
Exclude intervals containing poly-A stretches from analysis
Exclude intervals containing poly-U stretches from learning
Exclude intervals containing poly-U stretches from analysis
Fit gamma shape k only for positions with min. covariate value
Maximum number of truncations at one position used for learning
param.help: NOTE: for sites with counts above threshold the whole covered regions will be ignored for learning!

param.label: Prior enrichment threshold
param.help: A KDE threshold corresponding to -pet read start counts at one position will be used for initial classification of 'non-enriched' and 'enriched' site

param.name: crosslink_bed_stats
param.label: Output learned parameter statistics file?

tool.help:
PureCLIP is a tool to detect protein-RNA interaction footprints from single-nucleotide CLIP-seq data, such as iCLIP and eCLIP. It accepts mapped eCLIP/iCLIP reads in BAM format as input and also supports control library and crosslink-associated (CL) motifs input for bias correction.
PureCLIP outputs two BED files, containing the found crosslink sites (first file) and binding regions (second file) that merge nearby crosslink sites to contiguous regions (region width controlled by -dm parameter).
By default, the tool parameters are set to values optimized for proteins binding to short defined binding regions, e.g. proteins binding to short specific motifs such as PUM2 and RBFOX2. This behaviour can be changed with the -bc option. The default setting -bc 0 is equivalent to manually setting -bdwn 50 -ntp 10 -ntp2 0 -b1p 0.01 -b2p 0.15. The second setting -bc 1 is designed for RBPs that produce larger clusters (proteins causing larger crosslink clusters with relatively lower read start counts, e.g. proteins binding to low complexity motifs). -bc 1 corresponds to the manual setting -bdwn 100 -antp -b2p 0.01 -b2p 0.1.
In case of different binding characteristics, you can manually adjust parameters -bdw, -bdwn, -b1p, -b2p, -antp or have a look at the online documentation for more details:
http://pureclip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html
